results.title: Chemistry for sixth forms: catalysis
results.creator_credit: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: The term “catalysis” and its importance in industrial processes; homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis; catalytic cracking of petroleum; Faraday’s theory on the cause of surface catalysis; Sabatier-Senderens process using nickel as a catalyst in hydrogenation of vegetable oils; effect of poisons on surface catalysis; effect of manganese dioxide on hydrogen peroxide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television

results.title: Chemistry and a changing world
results.brief_description: This film directs the student’s attention to the significance of chemistry in the modern world. It traces the steps leading up to the reproduction of electric furnace phosphorus. In showing the work of research chemists and chemical engineers who work from an original idea until it reaches its final form in the shape of a finished product, the film also provides information which may be of value in vocational guidance.

results.title: Chemical properties of water
results.brief_description: An explanation of the chemical properties of water in terms of the polar nature of the water molecule. Demonstrates chemical reactions of water with metals, metal oxides, non-metal oxides, and salts; shows how water, as a solvent, promotes other chemical reactions.

results.title: Cheddar Gorge and its caves
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Cheddar Gorge and its caves from the Stone Age to the present day. Some animated sequences assist with the explanation.

results.title: Check-in time
results.creator_credit: Bernard Selling, Karl Holtsnider and Franciscan Communications Center
results.brief_description: A film which is only incidentally about alcoholism but is, more importantly, about covenant and how one family understands it. Looks at the strengths and weaknesses of a family where the father is an alcoholic, and the way the family confronts the problem.

results.title: Chaucer's England with a special presentation of the Pardoner's Tale
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A dramatization of part of the Prologue to Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales and the Pardoner’s Tale. Evokes the life and characters of the time, and gives some details of Chaucer’s career and experiences, before going on to show the Pardoner himself. The narration and dialogue of the Prologue and the Pardoner’s Tale are given in a modern English translation which retains much of the metre and rhyme patterns of the original. Short passages are quoted in both the original Middle English and modern English.

results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Tom Manefield, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: Charting the universe with optical and radio telescopes
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains and illustrates instruments and methods used by astronomers. Describes work of radio astronomers and astrophysicists in search of facts about the universe. Shows cooperation between different observatories in solving mysteries of outer space. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Charley Squash goes to town
results.creator_credit: Duke Redbird and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film, based on an Indian comic-strip character created by Duke Redbird, telling the story of a young Indian who leaves the reserve to make his way in the city. Eventually he returns to the reserve and the ways of his people. Animation: Yvon Mallette, Marie Claire Berube. Voice and narration: Isaac Beaulieu. (Award: Philadelphia)

results.title: Charles Rennie Mackintosh
results.creator_credit: W. Thomson and S E F A Productions
results.brief_description: The work and achievements of Charles Rennie Mackintosh, architect and painter, in relation to Scottish traditions, the style of his own time and the Art Nouveau movement. Commentary: R. Horn.
